segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the advanced security audit policy setting, Audit Group Membership, which enables you to audit group memberships when they are enumerated on the client PC.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the advanced security audit policy setting, Audit Group Membership, which enables you to audit group memberships when they are enumerated on the client PC.

segment.source: Audit Group Membership enables you to audit group memberships when they are enumerated on the client computer.
segment.target: Audit Group Membership enables you to audit group memberships when they are enumerated on the client computer.

segment.source: This policy allows you to audit the group membership information in the user's logon token.
segment.target: This policy allows you to audit the group membership information in the user's logon token.

segment.source: Events in this subcategory are generated on the computer on which a logon session is created.
segment.target: Events in this subcategory are generated on the computer on which a logon session is created.

segment.source: For an interactive logon, the security audit event is generated on the computer that the user logged on to.
segment.target: For an interactive logon, the security audit event is generated on the computer that the user logged on to.

segment.source: For a network logon, such as accessing a shared folder on the network, the security audit event is generated on the computer hosting the resource.
segment.target: For a network logon, such as accessing a shared folder on the network, the security audit event is generated on the computer hosting the resource.

segment.source: You must also enable the Audit Logon subcategory.
segment.target: You must also enable the Audit Logon subcategory.

segment.source: Multiple events are generated if the group membership information cannot fit in a single security audit event
segment.target: Multiple events are generated if the group membership information cannot fit in a single security audit event

segment.source: Medium on a domain controller or network servers.
segment.target: Medium on a domain controller or network servers.

segment.source: Group membership information for logged in user can help to detect that member of specific domain or local group logged in to the machine (for example, member of database administrators, built-in local administrators, domain administrators, service accounts group or other high value groups).
segment.target: Group membership information for logged in user can help to detect that member of specific domain or local group logged in to the machine (for example, member of database administrators, built-in local administrators, domain administrators, service accounts group or other high value groups).

segment.source: For recommendations for using and analyzing the collected information, see the Security Monitoring Recommendations sections.
segment.target: For recommendations for using and analyzing the collected information, see the Security Monitoring Recommendations sections.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: Group membership information for logged in user can help to detect that member of specific domain or local group logged in to the machine (for example, member of database administrators, built-in local administrators, domain administrators, service accounts group or other high value groups).
segment.target: Group membership information for logged in user can help to detect that member of specific domain or local group logged in to the machine (for example, member of database administrators, built-in local administrators, domain administrators, service accounts group or other high value groups).

segment.source: For recommendations for using and analyzing the collected information, see the Security Monitoring Recommendations sections.
segment.target: For recommendations for using and analyzing the collected information, see the Security Monitoring Recommendations sections.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
